date: Tula T. G.wrote a review Oct 2024
text: I have no words to describe the experience of staying in this hotel. The perfect blend of the new with the traditional and historical.Very comfortable room, complete, with various amenities, we were received with a tray of strawberries wrapped in chocolate, with a bottle of rosé wine in the bucket with ice...All extremely friendly and attentive staff. The location is perfect. We got close to absolutely everything. And Braga is a very welcoming and charming city, it looks like it came out of a Disney movie.The hotel is a unique and unforgettable experience!

My husband and teenage girls stayed here for 7 days. What an excellent find everything was perfect. I would highly recommend staying here but must hire a car if you want to explore the area. What a beautiful hotel and resort cannot fault it

WE ( My son and his father ) are currently in the saccharum Hotel . Bespite the fact that this IS a New Hotel with Nice rooms etc the internal rules of the Hotel Management are far from Customer friendly  if you Travel with a Child : children under 16  years are not allowed to get into the only heated indoor Pool . In Dezember with Wind and rain outside this is a Desaster .On top everybody has to pay 20 Euro per Day per Person for using the spa Area .All in all this IS in My opinion not Customer oriented .

We stayed at this hotel last year and really liked it so decided to go back this year. Last year we had a room with a balcony but found it almost impossible to sit on it, it was so tiny so we decided not to pay extra for one this time. We had a corner room on the second floor which looked over the park and down the road to the sea front. There were windows on both sides of the corner and a small table and two chairs where we could sit and read our books and watch the rain pouring down. We needed the air conditioning on most nights and it was very quiet and you don't pay extra for it. The windows have blackout linings under the curtains so the light doesn't wake you up and there is very little outside noise. The downstairs bar is very good for coffee with very reasonable prices. We found all the staff polite and helpful. Everyone mentions the dull breakfasts which were still just as dull but you do get what you pay for and the central location and comfortable beds more than make up for the lack of a resort hotel type breakfast. Part of the sea front promenade is cordoned off while a new cruise ship dock is being constructed and we were a bit disappointed not to be able to walk all the way along the front. The hotel is about 10mins walk to the cable car which goes up to Monte. This is more expensive than the bus but the views are wonderful. Try to avoid going when the cruise ships are disgorging their passengers as there can be long queues. The main bus station is also near the cable car. Most of the restaurants seem to be good quality and I have reviewed some of these seperately. Yes it does rain sometimes but the people who live in Funchal are rightly proud of their little city and are very helpful to the slightly disorientated tourist. A word of warning. Don't hover on the pavement near one of the numerous zebra crossings unless you mean to cross the road. The very polite drivers will stop and wait for you to cross and I always felt obliged to do so although usually I had only stopped to admire a building and didn't want to be on the other side of the road!

Very well located apartments kept spotlessly clean by the staff. Fabulous views and big balcony. It's right by the beach, restaurants and bars so handy for those who may struggle with mobility. Owners are welcoming and easy to speak with

GreatEverything was perfectGreat facility, great facilities, lots of amenities, everything well maintained, staff very friendly and helpfulPerfect location by the poolKitchens very well equippedEverything very cleanWould happily come back anytime

Room small but cosy.No ventilation in bathroom.Breakfast quite good.Prices reasonableBed noisy when you moved.Not a problem for me, but my wife mentioned this.Terrace on 5th floor quite good.Staff friendly.Good location near town centre.Wasn't too noisy as double glazed door to balcony, and the balcony had shutters.Should have taken some pictures.

Beautiful hotel and rooms were immaculate. Basically an apartment on the beach. Beach and a few restaurants in walking distance. Great staff! From the lobby to the manager. And everyone in between. Great pool and private as well, beach was literally a five minute walk. A couple restaurants on the beach as well
Wonderful beds, nice shower and the apartments are fully equipped. Very well cleaned. Nice view from the balcony.The swimming pool is fine, large enough to swim laps. Friendly and correct staff.

Stop for one night at this Inn in the city center. Film decoration with linen that dries in the courtyard and beautiful lemon tree in the center! Clean rooms correct bedding. No breakfast but possibility in street cafes.

Modern hostel in the top off the trainstation in the middle of Lisbon. We had a ensuite double with a small bathroom. Nice shower. Simple but clean room with a bunkbed so they can also rent it as a 4 person room. Nice and clean shared kitchen and livingroom. Bit noisy at night when people return from bars and clubs. Staff is friendly (and partly american) and organises activities like bbq's, beachtours and pubcrawls.

What did I like most about this hotel?  It's hard to choose really between the amazing sea view from our room which almost jutted out over the cliff edge and the fantastic breakfast buffet with the best ever fresh fruit choice.  Or the wonderful restaurant with its limited but high quality a la carte dining.  Or maybe the the friendly and genuine staff.  Then again how about the lovely outdoor pool and chromotherapy indoor heated pool?  And ofcourse the lovely bar and numerous sitting out spaces to chill and relax.  Forget the 5* hotels in Funchal - we did both in our trip but this was our favourite by a long way.  If you're going to Madeira, book here.

Stylish decor in a beautifully restored building. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant food was excellent, and good value. Very comfortable room and very clean. We liked the location, short walk to the main tourist places, close to a good choice of places to eat.

We’ve just  returned from a 10 days stay at this wonderful Quinta. The staff is exceptional : from the lovely cleaning ladies who make sure that your room and bathroom is spotless, up to the kitchen staff who make your stay absolutely great and cook fabulous, up to the waiters who are so friendly that you feel at home. Many thanks to Marié, Ronaldo and Sjabi. Your smiles made our day. The peace and quiet was all we needed. The sheep and goats were a great surplus! Thank you all for making our holiday one of the best and lots of success in the future. Many hugs, Sandy and Guy, Belgium
Had a problem with my room (was no clean) and they said that it was only \my appreciation\"
month: since (for them) the room was clean. After a few hours
year: they changed the room past 2 am... At the end of my stay
extracted_date_str: I sent them an e-mail just informing of my appreciation of the hotel
extracted_date: and (in my opinion) what they needed to do to improve in those cases (since it happened to me before in other hotels and the answers from the other places was much better). The reply I got from them was even worse compared to what happened before
year_int: almost accusing a customer of doing a false statement and defending what their employees did and the \"policies\" of the hotel."

hotel_name: Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites, A Luxury Collection Resort & Spa
text: What a great place to spend a weekend or better yet, a week! The rooms were quite large with fabulous views of the pool, lawn and ocean. So many places to chill out so if you get bored at the beach, you can relax on one of the many lawns scattered with lawn chairs or one of the few pools. The spa was lovely and I got a 90 minute massage which was excellent.  Best place to end the day is at the champagne bar where you can watch the sunset over the pine cliffs! Will definitely return here with my hubby.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Châteaux
text: From the moment we walked into reception we received courteous and very helpful information about the hotel and the surrounding area. The best areas to view and when the best time to view them. Even when we made a comment about the room not having coffee or tea making facilities, Pedro turned up with a coffee machine as a very nice suprise. All of the staff were very helpful and we saw them not as staff but as friends.

The hotel was amazing (award winning building) and the staff very helpful and friendly. Beautiful rooms, lounge bar and restaurant. Situated at a square with 5 or 6 nice places to have drinks or simple dinner. This hotel is an absolute must do in Lisboa!

The ride was ok, but the airline lost my luggage at the Amsterdam airport.  They did deliver it the next day.  At the check in, the lady was very nice and offered me a deal on an executive room.  The room was very nice, had a nice bath tub, had some English Tv channels, the internet worked okay.  The manager seemed a little nervous, but tried to be helpful, when I complained about the shower temp being too low.  Had a nice visit to the castle on the hill near the coast.  The traffic wasn't too bad.  Nice out in the country.  The hotel charges a fortune if you want something scanned on to your E-mail.  The area seemed nice enough, but you'd have to travel aways to get things.I ended up having to see our Embassy.  The country of Portugal for some reason wouldn't let me leave because of where I am a contracted worker at, for the USA Government.  The Embassy made arrangements to get me out of the country.  It's best not to volunteer info on where you're going.  Have a good and safe trip!Rick MBagram / Kabul, Afganistan

nice small hotel situated next to its 4 star big bother. The rooms are very small but convenient and clean.The staff is at 5 star level with extremely friendly and helpful reception staff. Convenient location

This hotel offers an excellent base for a city break in Lisbon.The staff are excellent & deliver a very professional service.They were extremely helpful regarding sightseeing information.The Hotel offers all the creature comforts you require for a city break:Clean accommodation, bathroom facilities & an excellent free buffet breakfast.Free wi-fi throughout the entire hotel.The hotel is located 100m from Marques De Pombal Metro station on the blue line, from here you have direct access to the Biaxa-Chiado,the sightseeing bus tours or you could head north to Colegio Militar/Luz station where you will find an enormous shopping center beside Benfica FC.The hotel is just off the Avenue & is a very nice 10 minute walk down hill to the city center.The Hotel is also located 100m from the Airport bus stop & the journey to the Airport takes less than 15 mins @ €3.50.I would highly recommend this hotel.

My friend and i shared a studio apartment in Clube Oceano June 2007.  We had a ground floor apartment which had perfect access to the pool via a few steps.Apartment itself was large, spaceous, clean and pretty well stocked (except for only having 1 very flat pillow and no iron).  They were cleaned every other day.  There was a lack of wardrobe space but it was fine.  In general i thought it was a nice apartment. Good block out curtins to blockout the light and i cant say i found it noisy even though we were on the ground floor.Staff were also pretty helpful and informative.There is a little mini market 2 mins away where you can get things for the morning such as rolls,yoghurts, water etc.The apartments are situated about 20 min walk to the old town and strip.  We didnt walk it but get a taxi instead.  This was 4 euro plus a euro to the hotel for making the call!!!   The only thing was a shortage of taxis at the busy time of 8pm ish.  One night they could not get us a cab but told us there was a bus stop literally at the top of the road which brings you to the old twon for 1 euro!! It seems to be at about 10 past the hour i.e we got the 8.10pm bus most evenings.We both prefered the atmosphere of the old town. The Bank restaurant is a must... lovely menu, lots of variety and excellent food. Ate here twice.  Across from that is a steakhouse - cant remember the name but i would recommend it also.  In the strip we ate at wild and co which again was very nice and would recommend it. Also definately try the Green wine - its yum!!! its available in all restaurants.While n albufaira we went to the Zoomarine.  It was ok but nothing extraordinary (kids would love it). We also did a cruise which i would recommend.  Went to a gypsy market which is held on a wednesday. Dont bother its full of crap!!! Stoped off at Villamoura marina which was nice but didnt get to spend a lot of time there.Overall i was impressed with the apartments and enjoyed my week in albfaira but a week is definately enough... another week and i would have been bored i think.... enjoy....

Not worth the 340 euro price tag! They charge 30 euros per extra person per night (in the wife!) and then an extra 15 euros for the pool. The breakfast is far from tasty and the windows cannot be opened as the noise level outside is simply too much. I cannot believe they charge so much and give so little in return. No fridge in the rooms, probably to ensure you don’t bring in your own food and purchase theirs. Just feels like they’re trying to charge you money wherever they can.

The first positive thing we noticed was the price. Knowing that we were a group of young people, who wanted to save as much money as we could, The Independente Hostel & Suites suited perfectly our budget.What we didn't expect was how excellent the localization was. Just in front of one of the most emblematic miradouro of the city, the wide windows reveled the spectacular views of Lisbon. It is also surrounded by many streets full with nice restaurants of local food.Going on to the rooms, we were impressed by their pleasant decoration and its welcoming atmosphere. All this summed to an inviting common Lounge, composed by a kitchen and a living room.On the other hand, the service was excellent, always available and understanding. We can't forget to mention the activities organized by the Hostel, such as the Bike tour given by Verena Wilder. She leaded us in an interactive and enjoyable journey to Belem which gave us a new and different perspective of the city. Our guide proved to be very helpful and well-mannered, as well as efficient when one of our friend hurt themselves accidentally. We really valued her care.Only inconvenient, the restaurant didn't offer the quality (and quantity) it's price should give.Otherwise, The Independente Hostel & Suites is an excellent place to stay in Lisbon, and I truly recommended to groups of friends who look or a nice and affordable establishment.

Using TripAdvisor reviews, a co-worker and I chose this lodging for a recent short business trip to Lisbon.  Exactly what we were looking for in a hotel - reasonably priced, attentive staff, convenient location, quiet neighborhood, and a decent in house restaurant.  A pleasant find

Recent visit to the city,we stayed at the hotel which is a close proximity to the airport.Breakfast was decent with a good spread.Staff on the whole,is good.The door man(don't quite recollect his name,who works generally in the evening)was the best among the entire team from our point of view,who was welcoming and very friendly

I would like to thank the staff who guessed I needed a room for a disabled person when I sent an email about parking for the disabled. I had not requested a room for a disabled person, so the email was the only way they knew my needs. So, thank you so much. The furnishings and sanitaryware were clean and in first class condition. The fridge and safe did not work and a Maintenance man came and changed the fridge and we worked out the safe configurations. So, again, thank you for your prompt assistance. We were halfboard and the breakfast buffet was excellent with a good selection including full English. The evening meals could have been better with more variety of potato dishes instead of only chips which it was on both the evenings we were staying. The desserts did not look very appetising either. Although we have negative comments about this hotel we would still recommend it and give an excellent rating

Top hotel with very engaged service team, very friendly, natural and down to earth. They seem to like what they do!Exellent SPE (premium service package)Stunning views from many rooms, everything well maintained

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Even if you don’t stay here you must come for the views from the bar terrace.The hotel exudes charm. It’s luxurious yet unpretentious. The staff everywhere are very friendly and simply excellent which really made our stay. The room was in the older part of the building - was on a smaller side but perfectly comfortable. Slightly irritating air conditioning unit noise from outside, at some times of the day. The breakfast was good with adequately varied dishes. We had a Sunday champagne buffet which was good fun, but, we did think that the food was bordering on average. The swimming pools were just fabulous and the gardens are beautiful.Would highly recommend.

Best choice in Evora. Completely new hotel, beautiful views of the town, very friendly service, well appointed rooms and great breakfast. Bathrooms in the room are not the traditional type and shower area opens directly to the room which offers little privacy. I was with my son so it was a bit inconvenient. Nothing though that would make me not come back again.There’s a nice pool area on top, with chairs and tables where you can have a snack or a drink. The hotel is not in the city center but an easy 10 minutes walk.

What a wonderful unique hotel with so much character. On the pricer side of hotels, the suite we stayed in was beautiful and had a balcony and outdoor hot tub. We enjoyed the outdoor space. The bathroom is a glass cube in the middle of the room and the ceilings were very high. The staff were very helpful with any inquiries we had and made our dinner reservations for us 2 or the 3 nights we stayed.  If we needed something in our room a quick phone call and it was there. The included breakfast buffet had plenty of delicious food and an a la carte menu if you preferred. We also enjoyed some great cocktails in the bistro/bar one evening. My only negative would be the lighting in the bathroom was a little dim and not enough counter space.

A reasonable and cheap hotel if you do not expect too much. In walking distance of the city centre. The staff are friendly. The cleaning lady had a good time arranging our rubberduckies next to the bathtub everyday.But at all cost avoid having dinner! It's expensive, tasteless and half raw.Rather have dinner in the original and typical portuguese restaurant just one block away. It's cheap, fresh and free of \touristmenu's\" ."

This stunning new hotel is fabulous!From moment we arrived until the day we left, everything was wonderful.Design, ambiance, staff, furnishings, breakfast, room with excellent bed and bedding; terrific bar and breakfast; helpful and happy staff.

I travelled with my husband and 11 year old daughter. It was such a wonderful stay. We were greeted with a coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice that was much appreciated after a long overnight flight. Beds were incredibly comfortable. Breakfast that was included was incredible and so worth it. Location is great - close to City Center. Staff was super accommodating and will go it of your way to ensure your stay is fantastic. Tiago, thank you for all your recommendations. Claudio, thank you for all your help and hospitality. Bruna, thank you for coming with me to the laundry mat close by to show me how the machines work. Love that it was a beautiful hotel but at the same time it was very quaint.

Fantastic hotel for luxury peace, tranquillity and superb service. Exceptional food and service from everyone throughout with a magnificent breakfast buffet. Ideal for a peaceful get away. I would recommended this hotel for couples wanting relaxing time together and walkers as there is easy access to levadas nearby.

Beautiful hotel, with stunning views. Great food and drink and friendly staff. We were there for a wedding with a few days either side. We made use of all the pools. We loved the cove (which was hard to access but wasn't part of hotel). The breakfast was so varied and tasty. Staff were attentive and the room was great for a family of four.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Our wedding at Reid's Palace was truely amazing. We were in touch with the hotel's coordinator Bebiana for nearly a year as we've organised our wedding from abroad. She was very helpful, responsive and clear about the prices, packages etc. When we finaly arrived to Madeira we had a meeting with all of our decorators, musicians and our coordinator at Reid's and this is when we've realised how amazing this place and the staff is.On the check in we've received 2 upgrades and had a beautiful room with a sea view. On the wedding day everything went very smooth thanks to the great cooperation of our planner and Bebiana. The staff and service was amazing, they were so flexible and helpful that we can't find words of gratitude. We've and our guests really enjoyed our wedding, thank you so much! We definitely need to be back to Reid's for our anniversary.

Staff very friendly. Food mainly very good but at times tended to be a little cold.asked for eggs freshly cooked one morning and was not greeted with a smile shall we say. Would however stay there again. Hopefully next time the beach will not be blocked off

Our stay at O Castelo couldn't have been better! The location was perfect for a short walk to the town and beach. The room was beautiful and clean with good hot water and shower pressure. The views of the sea from our room were spectacular. The owner was well organized and checked us in quickly upon arrival. The staff (especially Anna Maria & Luisa) were very helpful and pleasant! We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

We enjoyed everything about our stay at Pedras do Mar. The rooms were clean, large, comfortable, modern and felt spa-like. The pools and common spaces were beautiful and so comfortable. Many places to spend time outside of the room. We ate breakfast there daily and enjoyed dinner a few times as well - was all very tasty and well executed. The staff was incredibly helpful and always cheerful. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!The location was perfect for exploring the whole island and such a gorgeous scenic spot!

Staff really nice especially padro the young guy in the reception bar our room was cleaned every second day grounds kept very nice only thing is they need more pool lounges and umbrellas really enjoyed our stay will definitely stay again

date: Waldyr Cavalcanti Juniorwrote a review Jan 2024
text: Hotel very well located in Lisbon, An old building on a pedestrian street, but completely renovated, modern and very well decorated, only the apartment is a little small, has a good bathroom and the cleanliness and service were excellent. I really liked it, it's worth it. I indicate.

We are here now,been several Times still excellent breakfast and service,all reception staff friendly,Daniel on reception who booked us in was really good and helpful,for those of you who have been before and remember the beach carpet in all corridors they are all new absolutely lovely.

This hotel could be a genuine 5 star hotel (by British standards and not the lowered Southern European standards, where it seems that you should always automatically remove a star from any hotel’s rating if based in Southern or Eastern Europe - sorry). Without sounding like a snob (but completely aware I sound like a snob), real 5 star hotels welcome you upon arrival, take your bags, take you to your room, serve you drinks at the pool side, offer (and make) your coffee at breakfast and certainly do NOT make you collect your pool towels and impose a €50 charge if towels aren’t returned after use. My recommendation is that the management visit a few REAL 5 star hotels as the Crowne Plaza is clearly equipped and capable of being a real 5 star if it really wants to be (as the facilities and rooms are superb). Try London, Paris, Miami or Dubai. I’d be happy to join and make notes.

staff very friendly and very good English speakers-they will go and ask someone if they don't understand which we witnessed at the next door table at dinner!Room is very good large great bathroom free safe own fridge and kettle, totally forgot to bring a cup rang reception 15 min later we had two cups and saucers and spoons! Also our remote control seemed to be dying, rang reception at 9.30pm expecting to wait to tomorrow, Maintenance man knocked on door 10min later with some new batteries.Get complementary water every day if you use it up!Supermarket at the end of road.Pool is very cold but many people Braved it!Drink is expensive enough €7 for one baileys although wine was €3-4Lunch was €10 for toastie and chips down the street it's €4 depends if you want the hassle or not!Overall great holiday - o there's a ice machine on 4,6,8 took time finding it but worth having for drinks in room!

Ideally located just off Rossio square the Gat hotel was our base for two nights.. Close to two metro stations, so about 30 mins away from the airport, this hotel was just perfect for our stay. The room we had was clean, modern and bight as it had several floor length windows with Juliet balconies. The shower was fab, piping hot water after visiting the sights.The included breakfast was comprehensive; Egg boiler, Espresso machine and freshly squeezed oranges. No tea or coffee in the room but there is a machine in the common room near the open air decking on floor 1. The original staircase runs up through the hotel, an interesting feature. Staff were very friendly and highly informative and helpful when we were asking about tour buses. They had suggested one that we hadn’t thought of which worked out perfect for us…So all in all a great place stay and will certainly be booking in here when we return.. hopefully in the not too distant future

I have stayed at Cabanas at the beginning of the month. The cottages are beautifully decorated and the environment is very cozy. We woke up literally to the sound of birds. Also the breakfast is really good!Totally recommend!

The studio is very cozy and functional. We stayed 11 days in Deluxe Grey during the month of January/2025 and the stay was very pleasant. The hosts are very attentive and polite. The photos on the site are very true to the conditions of the property (which are impeccable), and the equipment is new, modern and efficient. The location is very central and close to the Forum (shopping), to restaurants, small markets, cafes, laundry, practically everything you need in a short season. We were satisfied and happy, and the city of Aveiro is charming.

If youâ€™re looking to visit the area for surf or other outdoor activities this is the ideal place to stay. Itâ€™s located a few minutes away from an amazing supermarket and not far from the town centre, literally 5 mins in a rental car or taxi. The staff know about the local surf spots and aregenerally really helpful. Thereâ€™s a lovely poolside bar. We stayed in a large twin room with a balcony. Showers are good and always hot. I wouldnâ€™t hesitate recommending this place. Go for it!

hotel is located directly at the metro station - so with a day ticket the city and the airport is easy to reach ! City 3 stations - airport 20 minutes !The staff is very friendly . The breakfast is good , was included in our rate .The rooms are quiet large and new . The bathroom is very clean . tv has international channels .Only the pillows could be better !

Super hotel for a restful week away for my wife and I. Spotlessly clean everywhere and friendly staff, especially the waiters in the restaurant who have a great sense of humour! A fairly small hotel with great views all round towards Funchal. Nice pool. Good breakfast. Away from the Town and there are no footpaths on the narrow winding roads but the hotel runs a courtesy bus and the local bus stops outside. The only negative comment is the noise of the occasional passing traffic as the road rubs right by the front of the hotel, is steep and has several bends. Noisy mopeds are still fashionable in Madeira. Otherwise super, recommended although perhaps not for families. We went during school term so not many children expected but there were none and most guests were of retirement age. Excellent for a rest in the sun (29 degrees end of September).

We stayed at Casa da Tita whilst waiting to make the house we bought in the village habitable. The rooms are beautiful, in fact the whole of Casa da Tita is very tastefully renovated and the accommodation bordering on the luxurious. Our host Miguel anf his father waited for us until the early hours of the morning because a delayed flight and greeted us with home made wine and cake. Miguel our host, speaks fluent English and is incredibly helpful on all fronts. And value for money on a par with the best I have experienced. We were blown away by Miguel and his family's hospitality and we look forward to have them as neighbours and friends in Nave do Barao.

Beautiful buildings and rooms, outstanding service, excellent food: this place has it all. The rooms are very spacious and well appointed, the breakfast leaves nothing to be desired and the other meals were amazing. The staff could not be friendlier and the settings are perfect for switching off. Highly recommended.

Personnel was super nice and  welcoming, room was very comfortable, clean and the view was wonderful! All of the staff is fluent in more than 3 languages! AMAZING breakfast buffet!!!I Can recommend this Hotel without a doubt!

We picked this hotel due to its proximity to the Ribeira neighborhood. It did not disappoint! It was a very modern and clean hotel less than 5 minutes away from the Dom Luis Bridge and the riverside area with many restaurants. Our room was very comfortable and we were provided with sufficient toiletries. The small balcony we had was also a nice touch, as we were able to relax on it and look out onto the river. We were also able to do a fairly long jog along the river, which was a beautiful and a great way to see this part of the city.

My two sisters, our 3 nieces and I stayed at the Clarion Suites in September.  What a nice hotel! Friendly, competent staff, a nice breakfast room with great room service and, rare for Lisbon, a lovely garden and pool.  Best of all were the spacious accomodations.  We rented the 3 bedroom suite which included a huge living room with dining area, full size kitchen and 3 full bathrooms and a half bath. It was a bargain considering the space.  Everything was very clean and I really can't say enough pleasant things about this property!

Stayed here for four nights. The most fantastic helpful staff. Beautiful room with really high standards of cleanlinessBar area lovely , food delicious and fab spa.Setting is beautiful with great views of river and surrounding area. Upstairs deck nicely done and quiet tooWe thoroughly enjoyed our stay

Yes, lovely hotel really friendly staff.Breakfast one of best,everything you could think of available, keep you going most of day .hotel is very center for buses.trams ,metro. Great views from.bedrooms .Will definitely go again ,Peter

We stayed for 1 night, our room is on the side, facing the side street, room is spacious, clean. My complain is the walls are so thin, I could hear next door, especially the toilet flushing, shower running, people outside in the hall way. There are a few parking spaces in front of the hotel, but they were reserved for a large tour bus the day we were there, luckily we were able to find some free parking up the street. If you have ear plugs, that's very useful.

Just returned from a 2 night break here, seeing the sights. Hotel lobby area clean and comfortable, some reception staff helpful, others not. Our double room overlooked the roundabout at the front and was TINY! The smallest double I've ever been allocated - not even space for a dressing table at which to put on make up - had to do that in the bathroom. We took travel kettle as no tea making facilities. Location good for getting into lisbon. Airport bus stop was hard to find - its on the road that exits the roundabout directly opposite the hotel (right over the other side). Breakfast was good and we appreciated the free wifi but unlikely to stay here again as room not up to 4 star standard.

The perfect hotel in São Miguel. Centrally located. Beautiful setting. Nice beach. Great breakfast. First class service. Wonderful front desk/ reception staff. Very courteous and knowledgeable.  We have stayed here many times over the years. Highly recommend.

Rooms great, service great and food was very good. No faults at all.Rooms had good wifi signal and were very comfortable with great views. The shower was like a rainfall and got me started for the day ahead.Will be going back without a doubt

We stayed at HF Fenix Lisboa for 7 nights during November and it was a very pleasant and convenient stay. The location of the hotel is right next to the metro station and right next to the first stop of the Hop-on Hop-off buses. Marques de Pombal is the best location to stay at when you are in Lisbon because it is just a 10 to 15 minutes walk to the city center and to the lively neighborhood of Rossio square. The hotel itself is clean and the staff are very welcoming. However, room service skipped cleaning our room during two days of our stay, but they were so quick to provide the necessary toiletries when asked. Breakfast was rich and the staff had a very cheerful manager who welcomes you with a huge smile. Even the people at the desk were so helpful and they guided us through the city. I really recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: ibis Styles Lisboa Centro Liberdade NE
text: The hotel is a 5min walk from the local metro slightly up hill the entrance is not wheelchair friendly, there is tea coffee making facilities in the lobby only no kettle in room? plus fresh apples,are  rooms are bigger (409) then  most other Ibis hotels we stayed  in fresh and clean rooms very contable bed and a nice large bathroom, the clothes hanging space is  little small  the bar/lounge area down stairs ic nice and airy.Breakfast is served on the 9 floor with views over the city a continental breakfast with  bread cold cheese and meats cereal fruit juice tea (many different flavors )coffee and a espresso machine  toast jam ect.

Lisbon is a tricky hotel town. Expo is a bit far but the old expo 98' infrastructure bring value and a touch of glamor even if a lot of white elephants are around. Enjoy ut! Come back to the hotel. Ukranian bartenders will serve a gret goose martini and the food is good.

I had the need for a night stop in Coimbra and found this option for the budget.Well located, nice clean rooms and all the things you need from a 4 star hotel.Very good & recommended. Large pool, good continental breakfast for additional 7 euro per pax.Booked thru an online site with a rate around 50€.

Nice average, clean, hotel but with the worst coffee I have ever tasted! Staff obviously don't drink the coffee from their own machines.Get to town centre easily with bus-lines, that don't drive too often at night, so plan ahead.

Stayed there in September as part of a Trafalgar Tour.  it's the closest hotel to the shrine - just across the road in fact.  The rooms are adequate and the meals are passable.  All in all it doesn't make the four star rating.  It's purpose is to accommodate those wishing to visit the shrine which seems to be the onluy 'attraction in town.  A bit like Lourdes but I should add this hotel is way above the vast majority of hotels found there.
